item.title: zeromq: DEALER/ROUTER pair
item.description:
We use zeromq's REQUEST/REPLY pair extensively. This pattern is simple and easy to implement, but has some limitations. The biggest one being it follows a strict request-reply-request-reply chain. And this communication pattern does not apply in some real world scenarios, for example, when live market data is streaming into the system.

That's when I thought of converting some REQ/REP pairs to DEALER/ROUTER pairs, as they allow very flexible bi-directional communication. Surprisingly I cannot find any good tutorials on creating a basic DEALER/ROUTER pair, hence this post.
